courses.name: Introduction to Biology
courses.description: Fundamental concepts of biology including cellular structure, genetics, and evolution.

courses.name: Chemistry Foundations
courses.description: Basic principles of chemistry covering atomic structure, chemical bonding, and reactions.

courses.name: Physics for Engineers
courses.description: Mechanics, thermodynamics, and electromagnetism with engineering applications.

courses.name: Introduction to Neuroscience
courses.description: An overview of the nervous system, including structure, function, and disorders.

courses.name: Organic Chemistry
courses.description: Study of carbon compounds including structure, bonding, and reactions.

courses.name: Mathematics for Scientists
courses.description: Mathematical techniques and methods applied in scientific research and analysis.

courses.name: Environmental Science
courses.description: Interdisciplinary study of environmental systems, ecology, and sustainability.

courses.name: Cell Biology
courses.description: Detailed study of cellular structure, function, and processes.

courses.name: Introduction to Astronomy
courses.description: Exploration of the universe, celestial objects, and astronomical phenomena.

courses.name: Biochemistry
courses.description: Chemical processes and substances occurring within living organisms.

courses.name: Genetics and Molecular Biology
courses.description: Study of genes, genetic variation, and molecular mechanisms of inheritance.

courses.name: Geology and Earth Sciences
courses.description: Formation, composition, and processes of the Earth's structure and surface.

courses.name: Ecology and Ecosystems
courses.description: Interactions between organisms and their environment, including population dynamics.

courses.name: Physical Chemistry
courses.description: Study of chemical systems and processes using principles of physics.

courses.name: Biostatistics
courses.description: Statistical methods applied to biological and medical research.

courses.name: Introduction to Bioinformatics
courses.description: Application of computational methods in biological research and analysis.

courses.name: Botany and Plant Biology
courses.description: Study of plants, their structure, physiology, and ecological relationships.

courses.name: Microbiology
courses.description: Microorganisms, their diversity, structure, function, and impact on the environment and human health.

courses.name: Chemical Engineering Fundamentals
courses.description: Principles and applications of chemical engineering in various industries.

courses.name: Neurobiology
courses.description: Study of the nervous system, including structure, function, and neurological disorders.
